remand.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to send someone back from a court of law, to wait for their trial
remand.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Smith was remanded in custody  (=kept in prison) until Tuesday.
Heâ€™s been remanded on bail for a month  (=allowed to leave the law court and go home to wait for trial).
remand.translation[0].definitions[0].not: Remand is usually passive in this meaning
remand.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to send a case to be dealt with in another court
remand.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The court remanded the case for trial.
remand.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the period of time that someone spends in prison before their trial
remand.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Evans committed suicide while on remand in Parkhurst prison.
